qas.question: Who invented the first analog computer in the form of a tide-predicting machine?
When was the first analog computer in the form of a tide-predicting machine created?
Who created the idea of the differential analyzer in 1876?
James Thomson was the brother of what famous figure?

context: The first modern analog computer was a tide-predicting machine, invented by <a0_0>Sir William Thomson<a0_0/> in <a1_0>1872<a1_0/>. The differential analyser, a mechanical analog computer designed to solve differential equations by integration using wheel-and-disc mechanisms, was conceptualized in 1876 by <a2_0>James Thomson<a2_0/>, the brother of the more famous <a3_0>Lord Kelvin<a3_0/>.
